abstract: International Center for Settlement of Investment Disputes rules El Salvador's government does not have to pay compensation to mining company Pac Rim Cayman after denying it concession to drill for gold; ruling comes as victory for government and for activists arguing for rights of governments to make laws protecting citizens’ health and environment against challenges from corporations.

headline.print_headline: El Salvador Wins Dispute Over Denying a Mining Permit
headline.main: El Salvador Wins Dispute Over Denying a Mining Permit

keywords.value: International Center for Settlement of Investment Disputes
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: An international arbitration panel ruled that the government did not have to pay compensation to Pac Rim Cayman for denying it a concession to drill for gold....
lead_paragraph: An international arbitration panel ruled that the government did not have to pay compensation to Pac Rim Cayman for denying it a concession to drill for gold.
